intro: Stenodraba fastigiata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, arranged in clusters at the tips of its stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
